chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant John W Rehlinger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Disclose to any physician in writing your conditions of probation.  Sign Medical Release for Agent.  Follow through with any treatment and or counseling recommended by Agent.

No contact with victims.
DNA previously done.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.

Defendant John W Rehlinger in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Cases 13CF1128 and 15CF673 are dismissed and read into this case.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Weathers makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1. 

Imposed Sentence of:

20 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days) Consecutive to any other sentence.  
10 Years of Initial Confinement
10 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with victims.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
Inform agent of all prescriptions;
Disclose to any physician in writing your conditions of probation 
Sign Medical Release for Agent;
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.
Cost:  WAIVED
DNA Previously done.  
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-07-2016 01:30 pm
from DCI

Case called early, defendant excused from appearing.  Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant John W Rehlinger did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court schedules plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing at 02-05-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant John W Rehlinger appeared by video conference from DCI.  Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers appeared in Court.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers has not received the plea documents from the defendant.  Court needs to find out if the defendant is still wishing to proceed to a plea or if we need to set this case for trial.  Court schedules this matter for a hearing to schedule the correct hearing.  Defendant to appear by video from DCI for the next hearing date.  Defendant wishes to appear in person.  Court advises this next matter will only be a status hearing so the defendant will appear by video.  Hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Check Case scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-21-2016 03:30 pm

Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant John W Rehlinger did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court tried to have the defendant appear by video from DCI, but the video conference would not work stating an error on DCI's end.  Court calls this case without the defendants appearance.  Attorney Weathers makes statements regarding the unavailablity to move her client due to severe medical care.  Defense is requesting an adjournment of the PLEAS hearing because her client is looking to have more time to review discovery.  Waiver is needed by Attorney Weathers and client for his nonappearance at the pleas hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Check Case scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-11-2015 01:30 pm

Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant John W Rehlinger did not appear.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was to appear by video conference from DCI.  Court connected to video conference but client was not present in the room.  Attorney Weathers moves for her client to appear by video for a plea due to medical conditions.  Attorney Weathers to contact the court to advise how her client will be appearing for the PLEAS date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
